bestBHT.bht: Referring to the heartless rigor with which the legal rites were enforced, this fierce indictment condemns the lawyers for their grievous burdens on the people. With shameless inconsistency, these men burdened others with pettifogging interpretations, while avoiding personal involvement. They did not even touch the burdens or lend a helping hand. This passage highlights the hypocrisy and callousness of those claiming authority in matters of faith, reminding us of the suffering caused by such behavior and the need for genuine compassion.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: referring not so much to the irksomeness of the legal rites (though they were irksome)...
...as to the heartless rigor with which they were enforced...
Marvin Vincent: Even or also unto you lawyers, woe."
Archibald T. Robertson: A fierce indictment of scribes (lawyers) for their pettifogging interpretations of the written law in their oral teaching.
A terrible load which these lawyers did not pretend to carry themselves, not even 'with one of their fingers' to 'touch'.
A physician would understand the meaning of προσπαυω for feeling gently a sore spot or the pulse.
John Gill: Woe unto you also, ye lawyers... ye lade men with burdens grievous to be borne."
Ye yourselves touch not the burdens with one of your fingers.

bhtAttempts.bht: The verse in question is a fierce indictment of the scribes or lawyers for their heartless enforcement of the irksome and burdensome legal rites. These men of shameless inconsistency not only burdened the people with their pettifogging interpretations of the law, but also failed to carry the load themselves or even lend a helping hand. Their actions were grievous and burdensome, causing great suffering, while they shamelessly avoided any personal involvement or support. It is a stark reminder of the hypocrisy and callousness of those who claim to hold authority in matters of faith.

This passage condemns the lawyers or scribes for their heartless enforcement of burdensome legal rites, without offering any support or assistance to the people. Their pettifogging interpretations of the law and shameless inconsistency caused great suffering and hardship. They imposed the weight of these burdens on others, while refusing to lift a finger or genuinely engage with the challenges themselves. This serves as a stark reminder of the hypocrisy and callousness displayed by those who claim religious authority.

This passage denounces the lawyers or scribes for their rigorous enforcement of burdensome legal rites, which they did not even attempt to carry themselves or provide any assistance with. Their inconsistent behavior and pettifogging interpretations of the law caused immense suffering for the people. This rebuke serves as a powerful reminder of the hypocrisy and heartlessness exhibited by those who claim authority in matters of faith.

Referring to the heartless rigor with which the irksome legal rites were enforced by the lawyers, this verse presents a fierce indictment of their actions. These men of shameless inconsistency burdened the people with grievous loads, while not even touching them with one of their fingers. Their pettifogging interpretations and lack of personal involvement highlight the hypocrisy and callousness of those who claimed authority in matters of faith. It is a powerful reminder of the suffering caused by such behavior and the importance of genuine compassion.

Referring to the heartless rigor with which the legal rites were enforced, this fierce indictment condemns the lawyers for their grievous burdens on the people. With shameless inconsistency, these men burdened others with pettifogging interpretations, while avoiding personal involvement. They did not even touch the burdens or lend a helping hand. This passage highlights the hypocrisy and callousness of those claiming authority in matters of faith, reminding us of the suffering caused by such behavior and the need for genuine compassion.
